parameters: A selection of Beatrice’s transformative potions. You pick up the first one you see, and see a label on the side reading “Bootylicious”, hilarious. Looking at the others, it seems every one of them has a similarly dumb name, but thankfully it’s still pretty easy to figure out what they do. You suppose you could ask Beatrice as well, as she hovers over your shoulder the entire time you look.
You’re not going to learn how to cast magic on your own, so you walk up to the shopkeeper at her desk and nudge her slightly, gently waking her.
Hmmm... what? Oh, sorry about that young lady, I must’ve dozed off. I haven’t had many customers come in tonight, how can I help you today?

You’re a bit annoyed at being mistaken for a girl twice in one day, but at least there’s a reason for her confusion here, it’s not like many men have a reason to purchase magical supplies. You tell the shopkeeper that you want to try becoming a sorceress but have almost no knowledge of spellcasting.

Your parents never taught you magic? How odd, most families at least teach their daughters the basics. Oh well, I can teach you enough to get started, and since you’ll probably end up back here to buy supplies, I’ll give you your first lesson free of charge.
The first step is to get you out of those drab clothes, I don’t care how much of a tomboy you are, you’ll never be a good sorceress in boys clothes.

You really don’t know anything about magic, do you? The amount of magic a sorceress can channel is based on how in touch they are with their feminine side, and the first and easiest step towards that goal is looking good. That’s why most of the high-ranking sorceresses tend to be extremely beautiful women. Before you ask, I can’t explain why this is the case, I’ve never bothered much with the theory of magic.
Now, I should have some of my daughters’ old clothes in the back, so I’ll go get you something more suitable to wear. Stay put.

You’re going to have to wear girls clothes? You’re starting to regret coming in here, but you’re in too deep to turn back now. Magic seems like your last hope, and you’ll only have to try on the girls clothes for a minute, so you might as well find out if you can cast magic at all.

The shopkeeper returns quickly with a bundle of clothes, and ushers you into the storeroom to change. She's given you what seems to be some sort of apprentice sorceress' outfit, consisting of a black skirt with red trim, a red blouse with some sort of gold sigil you don’t recognize, and black stockings. And a red pair of panties.

\fbShit!\fb You hadn’t even thought about underwear. Trying on a skirt and blouse is all fine and dandy, but trying on a pair of panties just seems wrong, and it would be really humiliating if anyone saw them and realized you were a boy. On the other hand, it might seem odd if the shopkeeper finds out you aren’t wearing them, though she does already seem to think you’re a tomboy. Will you wear them?
As you approach, you notice that Beatrice is actually awake today, and you find yourself momentarily lost in her piercing green eyes until she greets you.
Hey sweetheart, welcome back to my shop. I know I only gave you the basics on how magic works, so if you’ve got anymore questions let me know, I might be able to help.
Ask Beatrice about the herbs you gathered
Ask Beatrice to help you feel like a girl
Ask Beatrice to help you feel like a girl again
Ask Beatrice about the mystery vial
Ask Beatrice if you can use her room to change
Ask Beatrice about the herbs you gathered
Ask Beatrice to help you feel like a girl
Ask Beatrice to help you feel like a girl again
Ask Beatrice about the mystery vial
Ask Beatrice if you can use her room to change
Ask Beatrice if she can uncurse your heels
Beatrice looks excited, ask her what she’s up to?
Go on that date with Beatrice
Ask Beatrice if she can do anything with your purity ring
Get Beatrice to modify the purity ring
Ask Beatrice if she can uncurse your heels
Beatrice looks excited, ask her what she’s up to?
Go on that date with Beatrice
Ask Beatrice if she can do anything with your purity ring
Get Beatrice to modify the purity ring
Ask Beatrice to uncurse your outfit
Ask Beatrice to help you feel like a girl again, again
Beatrice is fidgeting oddly, should you see what's going on?
Ask Beatrice about your penis situation...
Ask Beatrice about a chastity cage...
Ask Beatrice to uncurse your outfit
Ask Beatrice to help you feel like a girl again, again
Beatrice is fidgeting oddly, should you see what's going on?
Ask Beatrice about your penis situation...
Ask Beatrice about a chastity cage...

Walking into the store, you’re greeted with a pleasant sight. The sorceress who runs this shop appears to have fallen asleep at her desk, and with every intake of breath, her ample breasts seem ready to spill out of the top of her purple dress. Tearing your eyes away from \fithose,\fi you note that she is just overall gorgeous, every bit of her seeming to ooze with femininity, and you find yourself idly daydreaming of kissing her plump red lips.

Waking from your revere, you take a look around the shop, and see everything you expected to find in a magic shop. Wands, potions, books, and a variety of odd objects you would assume to be worthless junk if you hadn’t found them in a magic shop.

\.\.\c[0]
You can't learn magic standing still, you ought to either
try and figure out what some of this stuff does,
or wake up the shopkeeper and ask her for some help.

Feeling apprehensive about waking the shopkeeper, you decide to poke around the store a little bit, maybe get a better idea about how spellcasting works. You start by looking at the wands, picking them up and waving them around, but you don’t notice anything special about them, so you move onto the books. Most of them are written in some language you don’t understand, but you find one titled “The Basics of Magic” that is written in plain English. Opening to a random page, you read \fi“When casting spells, some of the elemental energy you channel will not be expelled when you cast. Instead, this energy resides within your body, and will combine with the next element you cast, as \filong as it is a different element, creating a new spell. With the many types of elements available, the combinations are nearly endless, though very few spellcasters are able to channel all of the elements.”\fi

Interesting, but you doubt you’d have enough time to read much more of this before the shopkeeper wakes up, so you move on to the weird looking junk. One looks like a regular horn, which you are obviously not going to blow with the shopkeeper fast asleep at her desk. Another looks like a cube of marble, which you poke several times to no effect. Lastly, you walk up to a black cylinder, which you stretch your arm out to poke, before being interrupted.
Don’t poke that you fool, hasn’t anyone ever taught you not to mess around with magical artifacts you know nothing about!
You turn around, startled and embarrassed, while also wondering what kind of magic you nearly unleashed.
<CC Face: 1>Sorry, I don’t know much about magic, which is why I came here in the first place.

Well your lack of magical knowledge was evident from the way you fumbled around the shop, who doesn’t teach their daughter at least the basics of magic these days, humph. Anyways, you’ve come to the right place if you’re looking to learn, though I can only teach you the basics.

Your frustration at being mistaken for a girl \fbagain\fb almost causes you to speak up and correct her, but you’re not sure if she would even try teaching magic to a boy, so you swallow your pride and keep your mouth shut.
The first step is to get you out of those drab clothes, I don’t care how much of a tomboy you are, you’ll never be a good sorceress in boys clothes.

You really don’t know anything about magic, do you? The amount of magic a sorceress can channel is based on how in touch they are with their feminine side, and the first and easiest step towards that goal is looking good. That’s why most of the high-ranking sorceresses tend to be extremely beautiful women. Before you ask, I can’t explain why this is the case, I’ve never bothered much with the theory of magic.
Now, I should have some of my daughters’ old clothes in the back, so I’ll go get you something more suitable to wear. Stay put.

You’re going to have to wear girls clothes? You’re starting to regret coming in here, but you’re in too deep to turn back now. Magic seems like your last hope, and you’ll only have to try on the girls clothes for a minute, so you might as well find out if you can cast magic at all.

The shopkeeper returns quickly with a bundle of clothes, and ushers you into the storeroom to change. She's given you what seems to be some sort of apprentice sorceress' outfit, consisting of a black skirt with red trim, a red blouse with some sort of gold sigil you don’t recognize, and black stockings. And a red pair of panties.

\fbShit!\fb You hadn’t even thought about underwear. Trying on a skirt and blouse is all fine and dandy, but trying on a pair of panties just seems wrong, and it would be really humiliating if anyone saw them and realized you were a boy. On the other hand, it might seem odd if the shopkeeper finds out you aren’t wearing them, though she does already seem to think you’re a tomboy. Will you wear them?
\fiHeyyyy,\fi welcome back! I've got a present for you!
Beatrice jumps you the second you walk in the door, pulling you into an embrace that just so happens to push your face directly into one of her breasts. Seems she isn't wearing a bra today, either.
What? Oh, no, that's not the present. Might have a similar effect though. \fbI\fb got some more ingredients for my potion crafting, \fitada!\fi
Beatrice holds out a vial of some sort of dark amber liquid.
<CC Face: 1>Okay, neat, but what does it do?
Why don't you down it and find out?
<CC Face: 1>I probably wouldn't drink a potion randomly handed to me in the first place, but if you're the one handing it to me? That's suicide, Beatrice.
Hey! I'd probably never give you something that would \fikill\fi you, and if I did, I'm sure you'd die happy.
<CC Face: 1>Probably isn't good enough when it comes to me dying, what does the potion do?
Fine, spoilsport, it's a potent aphrodisiac. \fiVery\fi potent. I'll have you know I had to go through a lot of tentacles to get this for you, you could at least sound more excited.
<CC Face: 1>Why would I even need an aphrodisiac?

I... Okay, fine, you raise a good point. It would probably be fun to use though, so there's that. For only ten silver, you can have your very own vial of it! Thanks to the generous, \fidonation,\fi I received, I can make as many of these babies as you'd like.
<CC Face: 1>Wait, ten silver? I thought this was supposed to be a gift?
Just because it's a gift doesn't mean it needs to be free. I am still running a business here, after all.
<CC Face: 1>Actually, the whole point of a gift \fiis\fi that it's free.
Fine! You've haggled me down, I'll give them to you, and only you, for the low, low price of \fbfive\fb silver, how's that sound?
<CC Face: 1>I'll think about it, I guess.
Oh, and it will also make your balls overflow with cum, almost forgot about that.

You step back into the Sorcerer's Cauldron, and quickly take in your surroundings. Though the store has several magical orbs providing light, you’re still able to get a better look at the interior now that it is daytime.

The walls are covered in dark wooden shelves, lined mostly with various books, but with small sections dedicated to potions and magical artifacts. Besides the counter where Beatrice sits, the rest of the room is relatively empty, the floors covered in purple rugs embroidered with silver magical symbols. The only other things of note in the room are the two doorways at the back, one being the storeroom you changed in last time. Purple seems to be the theme of the store, as there are purple drapes along the front windows, and the shelves are lined in purple fabric. Overall, the place seems almost stereotypical of what one would expect for a magic shop.
Beatrice is actually awake today, and you find yourself momentarily lost in her piercing green eyes until she calls out to you.

Oh hey, welcome back to my shop. I kind of forgot before, but I should \fiprobably\fi tell you how to get better at using magic, you don't want to be stuck flinging wimpy little ice cubes your whole life, do you?

Great! So, there's two main ways to increase your magical prowess, the fun way, and the boring way. The fun way is getting more in touch with your girl side, doing things that make you look or feel more feminine would be the easiest way to boost your power. Judging by the clothes you wore when you first walked in here, I assume you consider yourself some sort of tomboy, and there’s nothing wrong with that of course, but you are limiting your own potential through your looks and behaviour.

For your appearance, clothing can go a long way, the more girly you look, the better, though you can do that in multiple different ways. For example, you could wear really daring clothes and try to be as sexy as possible, or you could wear more modest clothes with very feminine designs, lots of flowers and lace, that kind of thing. Makeup would work in essentially the same way, as I can see you aren’t wearing any at the moment. In addition to clothes, you could also use more permanent measures. There are some potions you can get that can change certain aspects of your appearance, like making your lips plumper or enlarging your breasts, that could increase your femininity, in turn increasing your magical power.

Behaviour would be a bit trickier, as women have varying opinions are what they consider ladylike, and there’s no real 'right way' to go about it. I could probably try and teach you a little bit about acting more ladylike, if you'd like.

You feel panic begin to well up in your chest. Does that mean being a boy will cripple your magic ability? How are you supposed to behave like a girl? You're probably going to have to confess to Beatrice, and tell her you're actually a boy. Otherwise, you aren't sure how much she could really help you. It’s not like you lied about being a girl anyway, you just didn’t get around to correcting her when she called you a girl, that’s all.

\c[4]"Um, how am I supposed to act more feminine when I'm, you know, a boy?"

\.\.\c[0]

\c[4]"Uhhh...\. Male?\. A guy,\. a man,\. not female? I came in here wearing boys clothes because I'm a boy, not because I'm a tomboy."

\.\.\c[0]

Beatrice stares at you blankly for a few seconds, before bursting out laughing. You cross your arms and shoot her a glare as you wait for her to stop laughing, and eventually she calms down and see’s the look on your face.

\c[31]"Oh my, you’re serious, aren’t you? Look, I’ll admit if I had seen you anywhere other than in a magic shop, I wouldn’t have known whether you were a boy or a girl at first glance, but boys can’t cast magic, I mean, how would a boy channel their inner femininity? If you want me to treat you like a boy, that’s fine with me, but when we are talking about improving your magic the first step would be to come to accept the fact that you’re a girl, even if you express that in a rather unique way."

\.\.\c[0]

\c[4]"This isn’t about expressing myself, I don't just \fifeel\fi like a boy, I am one!"

\.\.\c[0]
Prove it? What the hell does she mean by... oh. \fiProve\fi it, huh?
See, that look on your face says it all, now why don’t we...

She trails off, as you’ve pulled out your penis by now, and stares at your crotch slack jawed. You’d be thrilled to get that sort of reaction in any other circumstance, but right now you just feel uncomfortable, so you quickly pull your clothes back up and put your genitals back where they belong.

\c[31]"Er...\. well,\. that is to say...\. I, um, suppose I can’t doubt you now, can I? I guess I owe you an apology, but you must believe me when I say that I’ve never even \fbheard\fb of a man casting magic before. The fact that you can cast magic is one thing, but to have natural talent for it as a guy? It’s nothing short of spectacular."

\.\.\c[0]

Hearing her praise you like that helps cool your frustration a bit, and you decide to move onto the point of you coming here.

\.\.\c[0]

\c[4]"Well, now that we’ve gotten that out of the way, what do you think, will it be impossible for my magic to get stronger because I'm a boy? Do you think it’s possible for me to get stronger at casting magic by acting girly? I wouldn’t even know where to begin."

That is a good question, I suppose you could try to focus on the other method of gaining magical power, which is just by practicing and gaining experience with it, but that would put you at a massive disadvantage compared to every other sorceress out there. This is entirely new territory for me here, but I'd say it's at least worth a shot trying to boost your magic through femininity.

How do we try to make a boy feel feminine though? The first thing that comes to mind would be having others treat you like a girl. For example, I’ll try to treat you like a girl whenever you come into the shop, and it would probably be a good idea to give you a girl’s name, then when you’re in the shop I’ll call you by that instead of calling you \N[1]. So, any thoughts on what you’d like your girl name to be?
<CC Face: 1>Actually, I decided upon \N[2] when I joined the guild, as the receptionist wouldn't believe I was a male sorceress.

\N[2]. It suits you, I suppose. \N[2] it is then. Since I’m trying to help you get in touch with your feminine side, I’ll call you that from now on, but it will be up to you if you give people your boy name or your girl name. I’d certainly recommend using your girl name, as it will help you feel more feminine, but that's up to you.

That aside, I have another idea for how to make you feel like a girl, but it might make you a bit uncomfortable at first. The key is to find a way to actually make you \fifeel\fi like a girl, not just look like one, though that will also help. No, what we need to do is put you in a situation where you feel completely unmasculine, and to do that, I need to teach you how to feel pleasure like a girl does.
<CC Face: 1>Pleasure? You don’t mean that like, sexual pleasure, do you?

That’s exactly what I mean, which is why I said you might not be comfortable doing this. Being taught how girls feel pleasure is sure to be embarrassing for you, but in this case that’s a good thing. The fact that you’re uncomfortable means it’s something your masculine side is against, and by doing things that go against what you internally believe to be masculine, you should be more capable of embracing your feminine side.
Ask how Beatrice would make you feel like a girl
Ask how Beatrice would make you feel like a girl
Plopping your bundle of herbs onto her desk, you tell Beatrice you’re here to collect your reward for the quest.

Oh, you took care of that for me? I should’ve put two and two together with you wanting to learn magic, but I hadn’t considered you’d be a member of the guild. Actually, part of the reason I needed these ingredients was to help you feel more feminine, so let me know if you’re interested in trying something a bit different.
Beatrice hands you the reward of 15 silver pieces and a little copper token, which you inspect a bit, trying to figure out what it is for.
When you look up, you see Beatrice staring at you, looking a little zoned out.
<CC Face: 1>Is there something on my face?
She jumps a bit, blushing and raising a finger to her lips as she realizes she’s been staring.
Oh, no, I was just lost in thought for a moment there, sorry. I’ll let you go now, I’m sure the life of an adventurer is plenty busy.
<CC Face: 1>Uh, before I go I wanted to ask, what is this token thingy?

Oh, they didn’t tell you? Whenever you need to report that you’ve completed a quest to someone outside the guild, they should give you a token so the guild knows that you’ve actually completed it. It’s easier than having the person who made the request come all the way to the Guild Hall just to report it, just go give it to the receptionist when you get there.

A young girl is intently reading a book with something about “transformations” in the cover. You can’t make out the text without peering over her shoulder, which would be even more rude that peeking on her normally. She keeps peering out of the book directly at Beatrice’s chest though, which gives you a good idea of what she is after.
A woman is rummaging around the shelves, but it’s plain to see she’s really just here to ogle Beatrice. Does anyone actually come here to shop, or just to see Beatrice’s “goods.”

A young man, who presumably is not aware of how useless these products are for most men, is trying to use a book to hide the fact that he’s been staring at Beatrice’s chest for a minute straight now. You look over at Beatrice, and catch her eye as she beckons you closer.
This guy comes in every few days, pretends to read a book, and just stares at my tits. I mean, I know they’re pretty amazing, but wouldn’t that get boring?
You glance up from staring down the front of Beatrice’s dress.
<CC Face: 1>If you are bothered by him, why don’t you just give him the boot.

Oh I’m not bothered; he always buys a book when he’s had his fill of me. Honestly though, I don’t even think the boy can read, last time he bought “befriending your breasts,” which is a book about the best ways to masturbate with your nipples.
<CC Face: 1>What the hell kind of magic shop is this?
Maybe I should just confront him. How much silver do you think he’d pay for a tit-job?
Now that’s just insulting. A mere five silver for a pair of sweater puppies like these? Be more realistic.
Fifteen huh? Might be worth considering\..\..\.. or are you making an offer yourself?
If only she was being serious\..\..\..
Please, you think a guy who can’t read has that kind of coin? If I could find a guy like that, I’d retire.
A practice dummy. You aren't sure what purpose it would have here...

A dummy for testing spells. Thanks to the store somehow being "magic-proof", there's no risk of burning the place to cinders. You can practice combat against the dummy if you wish. \c[25]\fiAny mana spent will be restored afterwards. You can use the "exit combat" item you'll be given to stop practicing. The dummy has 1000 maximum health and 10 defense. \c[0]\fiFight the dummy?
